msDesc.head: William de Lanicea, Jordanus de Pisis (?), Nicolaus Stoer, Evangelium Nicodemi, Speculum humanae saluationis, etc.; Germany (Görlitz), 1417–1419

msItem.note: Fol. 1 is a nineteenth-century table of contents.

msItem.colophon: Anno ab incarnacione dominica Millesimo Quadringentesimo decimo nono sub octauis Sancte dorothee virginis Comparatus est presens liber per Apeczkouen Nuendorff presbiterum, etc.
msItem.note: Followed by table of contents listing all the texts in the manuscript (to fol. 339va).

msItem.author: William de Lanicea
msItem.title: Dieta salutis

msItem.incipit: Hec via ambulate ...; Magnam misericordiam feacit
Primo igitur nota de peccato uel vicio
msItem.explicit: imperium et maiestas per infinita secula seculorum amen
msItem.note: Fols. 46v-47r blank; text runs without a gap from 46rb to 47va.

msItem.incipit: Abiciamus opera tenebrarum et induamur arma lucis Ro. xiijo In adventu magni regis et principis expurgantur sordes
msItem.explicit: in contemplacione quere in materia
msItem.note: As pr. A. C. Peltier, S. Bonaventurae opera omnia (Paris 1864–71), 8. 347–358; Schneyer 2.472–474; Bloomfield 77.

msItem.incipit: Errare contingit tribus modis. Malam viam eligendo
msItem.explicit: cantus christi cuilibet choro electorum R’ etc. deo gracias etc. est finis etc.

msItem.finalRubric: Explicit Dyeta Salutis per Apeczkouen Nuendorf presbiterum conscripta sub anno Domini mº ccccxviijº in die Eufemie virginis et martiris Christi venerande

msItem.incipit: Veniet desideratus cunctis gentibus Aggey ijo Nota quod triplex est aduentus christi Primus in mundo Secundus in cordis scrinio
msItem.explicit: Propter iusticiam suam ad celum perueniet

msItem.incipit: Sol obscurabitur et luna non dabit lumen suum Mt. xxiiijo Nota quod in nouissimo die triplex sol obscuratur sol naturalis sol doctrinalis et supernaturalis
msItem.explicit: nos eripere dignetur omnipotens deus qui vivit et regnit in secula seculorum amen

msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber qui vocator Florentinus anno mº ccccxviijº in vigilia sancte Katherine virginis
msItem.note: Sixty-three sermons. Largely as listed by Christine Glassner, Inventar der Handschriften des Benedikinerstiftes Melk I (2000), pp. 196–200, with some textual variations. Sermons 20–24, 26–40, 43–65 in Glassner's list are Schneyer, 5.519–523 (nos. 7–50), attributed to Taddeo Dini. For the attribution to Jordanus de Pisis see C. Delcorno in Xenia medii aevi (Rome, 1978), and cf. Kaeppeli 2774.

The present sequence begins at Glassner's second sermon. Items 25, 41–2 in Glassner's list do not occur here; items 43–5 (Schneyer nos. 28–30) are in different order, items 51–52 (Schneyer nos. 35–6) are reversed in order. The final item here (= Schneyer no. 50) is not in Glassner's list. Between the seventh and eighth sermons as listed by Glassner is here an additional sermon:

msItem.incipit: Postquam consumati sunt dies octa Luce ijo Nota quod homo debet circumcidi tripliciter Primo cogitacione 2º locucione 3º operacione
msItem.explicit: comissa a deo

msItem.note: Apparently (at least from fol. 107vb) notes for sermons or draft sermons.

msItem.incipit: Memorare nouissima tua et in eternum non peccabis [Eccles. 7.40] Memoria mortis bona est
msItem.explicit: tartareis sepelitur. Conclude sicud placet etc.

msItem.incipit: Memorare nouissima tua et in eternum non peccabis Eccl. vjo Quia bonum est mortem nostram premeditari
msItem.explicit: pena mori angustia. Vltimum membrum potest subdiuidi sic recipiatur infrascripto

msItem.incipit: Memorare nouissima tua id est quinque que tibi contingunt que habentur in hiis versibus
msItem.explicit: quia sumatur animale corpus et surgit spirituale. Item de animabus.

msItem.incipit: Miseremini mei miseremini mei saltem vos amici mei Job 19 [21] Nota Job quedam verba locutus in persona propria quedam in persona ecclesie uel nature humane
msItem.explicit: palmas extendit ad pauperes pro quo sic ipse benedictus in secula seculorum amen

msItem.incipit: Vel possit sic capere dominus porrexit eis manum misericordie quando eos plasmavuit creando
msItem.explicit: et sufficit per sermonibus duobus etc.

msItem.incipit: Ne tradas domine animas confitentium tibi Et pauperum tuorum ne obliuiscaris in finem [Ps. 73.19] Vox est ecclesie orans pro viuis
msItem.explicit: sicud Lucia virgo matrem docuit conclude per te adde quid tibi placet
msItem.note:
Fol. 109v blank; text seems to continue without a break from fol. 109rb to 110ra (perijt memoria
cum sonitu, cf. Ps. 9.7).

msItem.incipit: Leprosi leuauerunt vocem suam dicentes iesu preceptor miserere nostri Lucis [17.13] Tria notantur in prefatis scilicet persone vociferantes persona ad quem fit vociferacio
msItem.explicit: Estote misericordes conclude per te et ora pro collectore et scriptore

msItem.incipit: Ad corisancium timorem et pudorem ut omnis homo fidelis siue laycus siue clericus sit caueat de corea notanda sunt alique de ea. Primo notanda est descripcio coree secundum Bernardum quod talis est Corea est circulus cuius centrum est diabolus
msItem.explicit: ludere et interfecti sunt xxiij milia hominum
msItem.note: Apparently extant in several other manuscripts, often with differing incipits: see for example, A. Madre, Nikolaus von Dinkelsbuehl. Leben und Schriften (1965), p. 296; K. Keller, Katalog der lateinischen Handschriften der Staatlichen Bibliothek Ansbach (1994), p. 273; eTK 0033A.

Cf. I. Kotvan, Rukopisy Univerzitnej knižnice v Bratislave (1970), p. 426, where identified as Conradus Waldhauser, Sermo de corea (for which see Verfasserlexicon 5, cols. 265–5), but the text here bears only a loose resemblance to that printed in J. Sedlak, Studie a texty k životopisu Husovu I (Olomouc, 1914), 429–35.

msItem.incipit: Utrum coreantes possunt comunicare. Questio corea quedam est laudabilis ut quando fit ad honorem dei ut maria soror moysi sumpsit tympanum et duxit choros transito mari rubeo
msItem.explicit: ex tali ludo alicui prouenire

msItem.title: Euangelium Nicodemi
msItem.incipit: Factum est in anno xviijo imperator tiberii
Anas et Cayphas et Dathan Gamaliel
msItem.explicit: posuit omnia verba in codicibus publicis pretorij sui et consilima audiamus etc.

msItem.incipit: Et post hec Pylatus scripsit epistolam
Poncius Pilatus regi Claudio suam salutem. Nuper accidit et quod ipse probaui
msItem.explicit: que gesta sunt de iesu in pretorio meo etc.
msItem.title: Epistola Pilati

msItem.incipit: Cumque hec claudimus Claudius suscepisset
msItem.explicit: ut essetis mihi in filios et ego vobis in patrem. Amen.
msItem.title: Somnium Neronis
msItem.note: E. von Dobschütz, ‘A collection of Old Latin Bible quotations, Somnium Neronis’, Journal of Theological Studies 16 (1915), 1–27 (= siglum M, ending at p. 22 l. 20)
All treated as one continuous work.
Fol. 126ra, cancelled, the opening of Speculum humanae saluationis (as on fol. 131ra).

msItem.title: Speculum humane saluacionis
msItem.incipit: Incipit speculum humane saluacionis In quo patet casus hominis et modus reparacionis
msItem.explicit: dignetur iesus christus rex celorum amen

msItem.note: Calendarial table of dominical letters, golden numbers, etc., for the years 1420–1444, followed by ten cisiojanus verses:
msItem.incipit: Prisca fab aug vincenti pau po nobile lumen

msItem.rubric: Nota tabulam optimam pro Interuallo pro litteris dominicalibus
msItem.incipit: Virtutum datrix subsidium optimum Maria
Notandum quod triplex ese natiuitas cristi. Prima dicitur eterna
msItem.explicit: clara die etc.

msItem.title: Sermones Dominicales
msItem.note: Apparently from Advent to the twenty-fourth Sunday after Trinity, although the feasts are not always given. Cf. Schneyer 8.586–90 (Munich, BSB, Clm 2717) and less closely Schneyer 8.698–702 (Munich, BSB, Clm 14812).

msItem.incipit: Vidi ciuitatem sanctam ibidem etc. Apocalipsis 21 [2] In verbis istis Johannes in Spiritu Sancto vidit ecclesiam cuius hodie dedicacio recolitur
Cum appropinquasset iesus ierosolimis Mt. xxi Quinque ponuntur in hoc ewangelio circa adventum domini in carnem. Primo ponitur causa motiua
Erunt signa in sole et lune Luc. 21 Nota quod propter sex signa apparebit dominus signa terribilia in creaturis ante iudicium
Cum audisset iohannes in vinculis Mt. ij Nota quod peccatum quinque mala facit in anima. Primo eam excecat
Beatus qui non fuit scandalizatus in me Nota quod multi scandalizantur
Ego vox clamantis in deserto Joh. 1o Nota quod christus clamauit et adhuc clamat
Cum esset desponsata mater iesu etc. Mt. 1o Ioseph a tribus in hoc ewangelio commendatur ab obseruacione legis
Factus est ex semine dauid secundum carnem Ro. 1o Nota quod christus voluit nasci de stirpe dauid propter .v. Primo ut esset rex
Ewangelizo vobis gaudium magnum Luc. 2 Nota quod propter plura gaudium vtilitatis dicitur magnum diuitissimediutissime exspectatum
Ecce positus hic in ruinam Luc. 2 Nota quod christus est in ruinam multorum Luc. xix. Non per causam quia venit
Cum natus esset iesus in betlehem Mt. 2 In hoc ewangelio beati magi multipliciter conmendantur. Primo quia celeriter dominum quesierunt
Quid est quod me querebatis Luc. 2 Nota quod septem de causis peccator non potest dominum invenire. Primo quia non querit
Nupcie facte sunt Jo. 2 Circa matrimonium Primo sciendum quod licitum sit relinquere sponsum sponsa et econtrario ante copulacionem
Domine si vis potes me mundare Mt. viijo Nota quod peccatum comparatur lepre propter plura. Primo quia peccatum totam animam inficit
Ascendente iesu in nauiculam Mt. viijo Ecce motus magnus etc. Per nauiculam designatur ecclesia. Nauicula enim beati petri est
Ite in vineam meam Mt. xx Nota quod penitencia comparatur vinee propter plura. Primo quia penitencia de facile impedi
Exiit qui seminat seminare Luc. viiijo Nota quod elimosina comparatur semini propter plura. Primo quia sicud seminas elegit meliora
Filius hominis tradetur principibus sacerdotum Luc. xviijo [recte Mk 10.33] Circa passionem christi hic quinque ponuntur scilicet tradicio illusio conspuicio flagellacio et occisio
Cvm ieiunasset quadraginta diebus Mt. iiijo Nota ad hoc quod ieiunium sit meritorium debet iiijor habere. Primum debet esse voluntarium
Miserere mei fili dauid Mt. xvo Nota quod septem sunt necessaria homini qui wult exaudiri
Erat iesus eiciens demonium [Luke 11.14] Nota quod multis modis possumus eicere temptaciones demonum
Est puer vnus hic Io vjo Nota quod possumus pueri pluribus modis . Primo per conseruacionem Innocencie
Quis ex vobis arguet me de peccato Joh. viijo Nota quod propter plura non possumus dominum arguere de peccatis nostris
Ascendam in palmam et aprehendam fructum eius Can. viiijo [Ct. 7.8] Nota quod crux domini dicitur palma propter plura. Primo quia durum habuit ascensum
Egrediemini filii syon et videte regem salomonem etc. Can. iijo Nota quod synagoga mater christi plura in signia pro derisione dedit christo
Maria Magdalena et Jacobi et salomee emerunt aromata etc. Marci xvjo. Adventus istarum sanctarum feminarum ad deo sepulchrum commendatur a pluribus
Venit iesus iamuis clausis Joh. xx Nota quod plura faciunt christum venire ad animam. Primum est tribulacio Exodi iijo
Christus passus est pro nobis 1e Petri 2o Nota quod omne peccatum aut originale aut actuale aut tantum in voluntate
Ego sum bonus pastor Joh. xo Nota quilibet pastor bonus spiritualis debet in se habere tria quinque Primo debet animam suam ponere pro ouibus
Obsecro vos tamquam aduenas et peregrinos abstinere vobis a carnalibus desideriis que militant carnalia desideria [1 Pet. 2.11] Quatuor modis militant carnalia desideria aduersus animam
Mulier cum parit Jo. 16 Circa partum spiritualem. Nota pericula plura.
Vado ad eum qui me misit Jo. 16 Nota quod propter plura necesse fuit christum ascendere ad patrem. Primo ad introducendum
Si quid petieritis patrem in nomine meo dabit Johannis 16 Nota quod propter sex fit homo indignus exaudiri a deo. Primo si petat excellenciam super alios
Cvm venerit paraclitus Jo. xvo Nota quod spiritus sanctus non venit corporaliter Joh. iiijo
Apparuerunt illis disperdite lingue tamquam ignis Actuum 2o Nota quod spiritus sanctus venit sub multiplici methaphora secundum capacitatem recipiencium
Homo quidam erat diues Luc. 16 Nota quod mali permittuntur a deo prosperari hic propter plura. Primo ut saltem per beneficia dei conuertantur
Homo quidam fecit cenam magnam Luc. xiiijo Cena hec designat eternam refecionem in qua dominus electis hominibus quinque fercula plura dat quam angelis
Erant appropinquantes ad iesum publicani ut audirent eum Luc. xvo Nota quod plura sunt qui trahunt nos ad christum. Primum est bonitas
Estote misericordes Luc. vjo Nota quinque de misericordia patris. Primo quia omnibus est communis
Cum turbe multe irruerent ad iesum ut audirent Luc. vo Nota quod mundus comparatur mari propter plura. Primo sicud per mare nullus saluatur nisi per lignum
Nisi habundauerit iusticia vestra plus quam scribarum Phariseorum [Mt. 5.20] Nota quod propter plura reprobatur reprobari a christo iusticia phariseorum
Nota per septem panes Marci viijo intelliguntur septem misericordie quas deus peccatoribus
Attendite a falsis prophetis qui veniunt ad vos etc. Mt. vijo Nota quod sunt false prophete a quibus cauendum est. Primus est dyabolus
Homo quidem erat diues et habebat etc. Luc. xvjo Nota quod propter plura hic villicus dictus villicus iniquitatis
Videns ciuitatem iesus fleuit super illam etc. [Luke 19.41] Nota quod dominus fleuit super ierusalem propter plura. Primo propter falsam intelligenciam
Duo homines ascenderunt in templum Luc. xviijo Nota quod quinque genera hominum difficulter ascendunt
Bene fecit omnia surdus etc. Marci vijo Primo quia inutiliter portat cor corpor’ sicud surdus aures
Samaritanus iter faciens Luc. 10 Samaritanus interpretatur custos et dominus noster iesus custodit uos quinque modis
Occurunt et decem viri leprosi qui steterunt a longe Luc. xvijo Nota quod isti leprosi peccatores fuerunt et se peccatores cognouerunt
Scit pater celestis quia etc. Mt. vjo [32] Nota quod deus pater noster est triplicater. Primo propter paternam generacionem
Ecce defunctus efferebatur Luc. vijo Nota quod aliquando homines moriuntur cicius
Ecce homo quidam ydropicus erat ante illum [Luke 14.2] Nota quod peccator dicitur ydropicus propter plura. Primo quid sicud ydropicus
Diliges dominum deum tuum etc. Mt. 22 Per multa signa cognoscitur diligens deum. Primo fideligenter et libenter audit verbum dei
Ascendens iesus in naviculam Mt. 9 Nota penitencia comparatur naui propter plura. Primo sicud nullus potest transire mare sine naui
Simile est regnum celorum homini regi qui fecit nupcias filio suo Mt. 22 Nota quod propter plura sponsus christus anime prediligendus est sponso carnali
Erat quidam regulus cuius filius infirmabatur Joh. iiijo Nota quod propter plura peccator comparatur febricitanti. Primo quia appetit sibi contraria
Redde quod debes Mt. 18 Nota quod in dei iudicii improbis exigitur racio de septem
Ascondite michi nummisma census Mt. 22 Nota quod moneta dei a moneta mundi seruus dei a seruis mundi propter plura discernitur
Filia fides tua saluam te fecit Mt. 9 Nota quod fides ad hoc quod saluum faciet credentem septem debet habere
Michi autem nimis honorati sunt amici tui deus etc. [Ps. 138.17] Ad honorem et utiliatem sacerdotii dignitatis
msItem.explicit: de mardocheo etc.

msItem.author: Nicolaus Stoer
msItem.title: Expositio officii Missae
msItem.rubric: In nomine sancte et individue trinitatis incipit exposicio super officium misse
msItem.incipit: Reuerendi patres ac domini cogitanti michi crebrius ac diligenti
Ad honorem benedicte et indiuidue trinitatis patris videlicet et filii et spiritus sancti sanctorumque patrocinorum
msItem.explicit: Laude ergo quia incepimus a laude quoque terminemus ut in eternum laudemus cum qui viuit et regnat in secula seculorum amen. Et sic est finis.
msItem.finalRubric: Finis est cuiusdam compilacionis magistri Stör super Officium tocius Misse composite in Liczpk [Leipzig]...

msItem.note: A brief chronicle of Saxony, 1408–62, in one hand to 1422, then in several (contemporary?) hands
To judge from the different paper stock, and their absence from the table of contents on fol. 3v, these leaves are a fifteenth-century addition to the original manuscript.

msItem.incipit: Genesis habet l et vnum capitula
msItem.explicit: Apocalipsis xxij capitula

msItem.incipit: Primo omnibus illis qui decimas non soluunt
msItem.explicit: Item qui in dominico die non intersunt diuino officio

msItem.rubric: Benedictio Vini in festum s. Ioannis Evangeliste [later hand]
msItem.incipit: In principio erat uerbum. Aliud in illo tempore Nupcie facte sunt in Chana galilee Recumbentibus vndecim discipulos Per istos sermones
Bene + dicere et consecrare dignat’ domine deum hunc calicem

msItem.title: Sermon
msItem.incipit: Ante diem festum pasche Johannes xiij Ante diem festum pasce Glosa id est ante primum diem sollemnitatis paschalis que fuit magis festiua aliis diebus pasche et sollempnior
msItem.explicit: non vt cibum corporalis sed anime nutrimentum

msItem.incipit: Sciendum quod pascha dicitur phase quod est transitus Quia angelus exterminator ad preceptum dei transsiuit
msItem.explicit: azyma post biduum etc.

msItem.note: Verses on the duties of a priest attributed to Johann Hoffmann bp. of Meissen (d. 1451)

supportDesc.support: paper Fols. 1–340: apparently more than one watermark, often indistinct. Fol. 193, tête de Boeuf/Ochsenkopf, 106 × 43 mm., between chainlines, 40mm. between chainlines; cf. Piccard I.xi.110–111. Fols. 341–347: watermark, sword with circle, 100 × 23 mm. between chainlines, c. 41 mm. between chainlines; cf. Piccard IX.vii.512–518.
supportDesc.collation: Fols. 3–340: quires numbered i-xxviij on the verso of the last leaf of each quire. Quires xvij-xxviij (fols. 194–340) additionally numbered 1–12 in a mixture of roman and arabic numbers on the recto of the first leaf of each quire.

layoutDesc.layout: Frame ruled, 2 cols., c. 37–47 lines, ruled space c. 210–15 c. 140–45 , column space c. 210–15 c. 60–65 .

binding.p: Blind-stamped calfskin (?) over boards, 15th century. Stamps: blattwerk [lily?] (cf. Einbanddatenbank s030419); vierblatt (cf. s030420), vierblatt (cf. s030421, all associated with the 'Löwe in Schild IIa' workshop (Einbanddatenbank 502651s; Schwenke-Schunke II.217). Two strap-and-pin fastenings, lost; 4+1 bosses on the front and back boards, lost.

history.origin: 1417–1419, with fifteenth–century additions German, Görlitz (in part)
history.provenance: Colophons, fol. 3v (covering the whole volume to fol. 340), fol. 72v (covering fols. 4–72v), and fol 102v (covering fols. 75–102v). That on fol. 3v shows that the undated parts after fol. 102 were written by 1419.
Damaged inscription, fol. 3r: Anno domini mº cccc xvij inceptus est presens liber mensis ap p’a in Gorlicz hora quat, suggesting that parts of the manuscript were in existence by 1417.

Attributed by Krämer on uncertain grounds and with query to St Peter's, Erfurt; perhaps more probably from the Cistercian abbey of Neuzelle given the manuscript's origin (and cf. some similarities with other bindings from Neuzelle), but positive evidence is lacking. The endleaf fol. 2 provides a further association with Neuzelle, but it is uncertain when it was bound into the present volume.
Not identifiable in the 1836 catalogue of Friedrich Gottlieb Julius von Bülow, 1760-?1831.
history.acquisition: Presented to the Bodleian Library by his sons and received in 1857.

recordHist.source: Description by Matthew Holford and Andrew Honey (binding), May 2019, rev. Sept. 2020, with assistance from Nigel Palmer on the German language items. Previously described in the Summary Catalogue (1905). Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 13 Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 14

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project

listBibl.bibl: A. G. Watson, Catalogue of Dated and Datable Manuscripts c.435–1600 in Oxford Libraries (Oxford, 1984), no. 492

msItem.author: Ludolf of Hildesheim
msItem.title: Summa dictaminis
msItem.note: Four consequtive bifolia, disordered, the correct order being [ii], [i], [348] (recto should be verso), [349], [349] being the central leaf of a quire. Text as Briefsteller unde formelbucher des eilften bis vierzehten jahrhunderts, ed. L. Rockinger I (1863) pp. 392–96.

supportDesc.extent: four bifolia at least 165 at least 120

layoutDesc.layout: Written below top line. 1 col., 22 lines, written space 120 90

msItem.author: Ps.-Albertus Magnus
msItem.title: Commentary on Apocalypse
msItem.incipit: mense et sabbatum ex sabbato
msItem.explicit: est exaltandus Mt. iiij dominum deum
msItem.note: On Apoc. 22.2–10, as ed. A. Borgnet, Alberti Magni Opera Omnia 38.784a-787b.
Not in its original position, as indicated by staining and worm-holes. Originally part of MS. Hamilton 21 (from Neuzelle), text continuing from the final leaf of that volume.

supportDesc.extent: one leaf at least 280 at least 205

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled, 2 cols., c. 42–44 lines, written space 225 160

revisionDesc.change: Sebastian Dows-Miller. Corrected typo in provenance.
Revised description of fol. 2 as part of cataloguing MS. Hamilton 21
Added description of binding stamps and additional provenance information.
Description revised for Polonksy digitization project.
